trans-unit.source: The CEIL or CEILING function rounds the specified number up, and returns the smallest number that is greater than or equal to the specified number.

seg-source.mrk: The CEIL or CEILING function rounds the specified number up, and returns the smallest number that is greater than or equal to the specified number.

target.mrk: The CEIL or CEILING function rounds the specified number up, and returns the smallest number that is greater than or equal to the specified number.

trans-unit.source: The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

seg-source.mrk: The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

target.mrk: The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is NULL, the returned value is NULL.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is NULL, the returned value is NULL.

target.mrk: If the specified number is NULL, the returned value is NULL.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is equal to a mathematical integer, the returned value is the same as the specified number.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is equal to a mathematical integer, the returned value is the same as the specified number.

target.mrk: If the specified number is equal to a mathematical integer, the returned value is the same as the specified number.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is zero (0), the returned value is zero.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is zero (0), the returned value is zero.

target.mrk: If the specified number is zero (0), the returned value is zero.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is less than zero but greater than -1.0, the returned value is zero.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is less than zero but greater than -1.0, the returned value is zero.

target.mrk: If the specified number is less than zero but greater than -1.0, the returned value is zero.

trans-unit.source: The returned value is the smallest (closest to negative infinity) double floating-point value that is greater than or equal to the specified number. The returned value is equal to a mathematical integer. The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.

seg-source.mrk: The returned value is the smallest (closest to negative infinity) double floating-point value that is greater than or equal to the specified number.
The returned value is equal to a mathematical integer.
The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.

target.mrk: The returned value is the smallest (closest to negative infinity) double floating-point value that is greater than or equal to the specified number.
The returned value is equal to a mathematical integer.
The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.
